intro: Notocactus turbinatus f. schaeferianus, commonly known as the Schaefer's Turbinated Cactus, is a unique variant of the Turbinated Cactus native to the arid regions of South America. This succulent plant features a cylindrical stem with a distinctive spiral pattern and a dense covering of white, woolly hairs. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, appearing in clusters at the top of the plant. The f. schaeferianus form is notable for its more elongated shape and reduced spination compared to the typical species. It is well adapted to dry environments, storing water in its thick, fleshy stems.
